prototype

Class CheckersAI

  • java.lang.Object
    • prototype.Player
      • prototype.CheckersAI

  • public class CheckersAI
extends Player
    The AI class is used when a player wants to play against the computer.
    Version:
    stable build 17 April 2018
    Author:
    Gionata Bonazzi, Cole Sellers, Brendan Cronan, Rosa Fleming

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Board board,
                     boolean[][] options,
                     Game game)
        Makes the move for the AI.
        Parameters:
        board - The current status of the board
        options - A boolean array of the move options
        game - The current game.

      • randomMove

        private int[] randomMove(boolean[][] options,
                         Game game)
        This clss is the logic behind choosing the random move, it will create a randondom number and choose a move from the options. If there are no moves, the method will change the player and stop the game, making the user the winner.
        Parameters:
        options - A boolean array of the move options
        game - The current game
        Returns:
        temp a pair of coordinates, row + col.

      • checkOptions

        private java.util.ArrayList<int[]> checkOptions(boolean[][] options)
        Creates an Arraylist of moves based on the boolean array options.
        Parameters:
        options - A boolean array of the move options
        Returns:
        An arraylist of all the possible moves.
